metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Regular Expressions
A regular expression is a sequence of characters that forms a search pattern.
content.html: A regular expression is a sequence of characters that forms a search pattern.

content.text: The search pattern can be used for text search and text replace operations.
content.html: The search pattern can be used for text search and text replace operations.

content.text: What Is a Regular Expression?
A regular expression is a sequence of characters that forms a search pattern .
content.html: A regular expression is a sequence of characters that forms a search pattern.

content.text: When you search for data in a text, you can use this search pattern to describe what you are searching for.
content.html: When you search for data in a text, you can use this search pattern to describe what you are searching for.

content.text: A regular expression can be a single character, or a more complicated pattern.
content.html: A regular expression can be a single character, or a more complicated pattern.

content.text: Regular expressions can be used to perform all types of text search and text replace operations.
content.html: Regular expressions can be used to perform all types of text search and text replace operations.

content.text: Syntax
Example explained:
content.html: Example explained:

content.text: /w3schools/i is a regular expression.
content.html: /w3schools/i  is a regular expression.

content.text: w3schools is a pattern (to be used in a search).
content.html: w3schools  is a pattern (to be used in a search).

content.text: i is a modifier (modifies the search to be case-insensitive).
content.html: i  is a modifier (modifies the search to be case-insensitive).

content.text: Using String Methods
In JavaScript, regular expressions are often used with the two string methods : search() and replace() .
content.html: In JavaScript, regular expressions are often used with the two string methods: search() and replace().

content.text: The search() method uses an expression to search for a match, and returns the position of the match.
content.html: The search() method uses an expression to search for a match, and returns the position of the match.

content.text: The replace() method returns a modified string where the pattern is replaced.
content.html: The replace() method returns a modified string where the pattern is replaced.

content.text: Using String search() With a String
The search() method searches a string for a specified value and returns the position of the match:
content.html: The search() method searches a string for a specified value and returns the position of the match:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
let text = "Visit W3Schools!";
let n = text.search("W3Schools");

content.code:
let text = "Visit W3Schools!";
let n = text.search("W3Schools");

syntax_highlighting.text:
let text = "Visit W3Schools!";
let n = text.search("W3Schools");

content.code_html:
let text = "Visit W3Schools!";
let n = text.search("W3Schools");

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
let text = "Visit W3Schools!";
let n = text.search("W3Schools");

content.text: Using String search() With a Regular Expression

syntaxHighlighting.text:
let text = "Visit W3Schools";
let n = text.search(/w3schools/i);

content.code:
let text = "Visit W3Schools";
let n = text.search(/w3schools/i);

syntax_highlighting.text:
let text = "Visit W3Schools";
let n = text.search(/w3schools/i);

content.code_html:
let text = "Visit W3Schools";
let n = text.search(/w3schools/i);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
let text = "Visit W3Schools";
let n = text.search(/w3schools/i);

content.text: Using String replace() With a String
The replace() method replaces a specified value with another value in a string:
content.html: The replace() method replaces a specified value with another value in a string:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace("Microsoft", "W3Schools");

content.code:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace("Microsoft", "W3Schools");

syntax_highlighting.text:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace("Microsoft", "W3Schools");

content.code_html:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace("Microsoft", "W3Schools");

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace("Microsoft", "W3Schools");

content.text: Use String replace() With a Regular Expression

syntaxHighlighting.text:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace(/microsoft/i, "W3Schools");

content.code:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace(/microsoft/i, "W3Schools");

syntax_highlighting.text:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace(/microsoft/i, "W3Schools");

content.code_html:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace(/microsoft/i, "W3Schools");

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
let text = "Visit Microsoft!";
let result = text.replace(/microsoft/i, "W3Schools");

content.text: Did You Notice?
Regular expression arguments (instead of string arguments) can be used in the methods above. Regular expressions can make your search much more powerful (case insensitive for example).
content.html:
Regular expression arguments (instead of string arguments) can be used in the methods above.
Regular expressions can make your search much more powerful (case insensitive for example).

content.text: Regular Expression Modifiers
Modifiers can be used to perform case-insensitive more global searches:
content.html: Modifiers can be used to perform case-insensitive more global searches:

content.code_html:
Modifier Description Try it
i Perform case-insensitive matching Try it »
g Perform a global match (find all) Try it »
m Perform multiline matching Try it »
d Perform start and end matching (New in ES2022) Try it »

content.text: Regular Expression Patterns
Brackets are used to find a range of characters:
content.html: Brackets are used to find a range of characters:

content.code_html:
Expression Description Try it
[abc] Find any of the characters between the brackets Try it »
[0-9] Find any of the digits between the brackets Try it »
(x|y) Find any of the alternatives separated with | Try it »

content.text: Metacharacters are characters with a special meaning:
content.html: Metacharacters are characters with a special meaning:

content.code_html:
Metacharacter Description Try it
\d Find a digit Try it »
\s Find a whitespace character Try it »
\b Find a match at the beginning of a word like this: \bWORD, or at the end of a word like this: WORD\b Try it »
Try it »
\uxxxx Find the Unicode character specified by the hexadecimal number xxxx Try it »

content.text: Quantifiers define quantities:
content.html: Quantifiers define quantities:

content.code_html:
Quantifier Description Try it
n+ Matches any string that contains at least one n Try it »
n* Matches any string that contains zero or more occurrences of n Try it »
n? Matches any string that contains zero or one occurrences of n Try it »

content.text: Using the RegExp Object
In JavaScript, the RegExp object is a regular expression object with predefined properties and methods.
content.html: In JavaScript, the RegExp object is a regular expression object with predefined properties and methods.

content.text: Using test()
The test() method is a RegExp expression method.
content.html: The test() method is a RegExp expression method.

content.text: It searches a string for a pattern, and returns true or false, depending on the result.
content.html: It searches a string for a pattern, and returns true or false, depending on the result.

content.text: The following example searches a string for the character "e":
content.html: The following example searches a string for the character "e":

syntaxHighlighting.text:
const pattern = /e/;
pattern.test("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.code:
const pattern = /e/;
pattern.test("The best things in life are free!");

syntax_highlighting.text:
const pattern = /e/;
pattern.test("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.code_html:
const pattern = /e/;
pattern.test("The best things in life are free!");

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
const pattern = /e/;
pattern.test("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

syntaxHighlighting.text: /e/.test("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.code: /e/.test("The best things in life are free!");

syntax_highlighting.text: /e/.test("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.code_html: /e/.test("The best things in life are free!");

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /e/.test("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.text: Using exec()
The exec() method is a RegExp expression method.
content.html: The exec() method is a RegExp expression method.

content.text: It searches a string for a specified pattern, and returns the found text as an object.
content.html: It searches a string for a specified pattern, and returns the found text as an object.

content.text: If no match is found, it returns an empty (null) object.
content.html: If no match is found, it returns an empty (null) object.

content.text: The following example searches a string for the character "e":
content.html: The following example searches a string for the character "e":

syntaxHighlighting.text: /e/.exec("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.code: /e/.exec("The best things in life are free!");

syntax_highlighting.text: /e/.exec("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.code_html: /e/.exec("The best things in life are free!");

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /e/.exec("The best things in life are free!");
"The best things in life are free!"

content.text: Complete RegExp Reference
For a complete reference, go to our Complete JavaScript RegExp Reference .
content.html: For a complete reference, go to our Complete JavaScript RegExp Reference.

content.text: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all RegExp properties and methods.
content.html: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all RegExp properties and methods.
